summary: Film noir is a type of Hollywood crime movie popular in the 1940s and 1950s. These movies often show characters with dark, cynical attitudes. They are usually in black and white, with a style influenced by German Expressionism. The term "film noir," meaning "black film" in French, was first used in 1946. Many of these stories came from hardboiled crime books popular during the Great Depression. Debates exist on whether film noir is a genre or a style. Classic characters include private investigators, police officers, and criminals. Film noir has influenced movies worldwide, with newer versions called neo-noir.
title: Film noir
